title: Screen tearing and stuttering
body: I just got a new computer and I am having some issues with the display in the game. I am having bad screen tearing near the towers and the home base, and sometimes when running the health bar just seems jittery and blurry. I put the same video card that was in my old pc into this one so I don't understand what could cause it. Vsync i still see tearing and have input lag. When I don't run it and just cap my frames to 60 the tearing is worse. Any higher than that its just really jittery. I don't have any other issues with my other games. I am running a quad core 3.2ghz, 8 gigs of ram, and a 2gig nvidia card gt 420 (not the greatest card but its to get me by for now). Any recommendations on what I could try?

replies.body:
Old post but I was having the same problem, especially with the health bar stutter. For me the problem was worse the closer I was to base fountain or around other champions. So far this has been my solution and I'm able to run at a high FPS at very high settings.

Nvidia Control Panel:
1. Set the preferred graphics processor as the NVIDIA processor for the **global settings**
2.  turn V-Sync ON

Program Settings (Nvidia Control Panel):
1. Use global settings for League

In game settings:
1. Uncapped FPS
2. turn OFF V-sync

I read somewhere that sometimes the in game application wants to chose the NVIDIA card but clashes with the integrated graphics and it can make the game skip around (or both V-Syncs are clashing, tbh I can't remember). This has solved my bar stutter and small screen tearing. If it's still not working try turning off windows aero too. Hope it works for others!
Toggling both actually helped a lot. Thank you so much! <3

Your PC might be too good, and you may be able to fixing the tearing both by toggling v-sync as well as capping your framerate.  In addition, make sure to go over the steps in our [FPS issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) guide to tune up your PC like updating drivers.  Since the PC is new, there may be some required updates.  Hope that helps!
